title: Membership

details.body:
The Independent Chief Inspector of Borders and Immigration has established a number of stakeholder forums to advise on specific areas of borders and immigration and make recommendations within their areas of expertise.

You can also get involved in the work of the Independent Chief Inspector of Borders and Immigration by contributing to specific inspections, contributing to the inspection plan or sharing knowledge.

Refugee and asylum forum

This forum was created by the Independent Chief Inspector of Borders and Immigration to develop regular opportunities for expert asylum groups to engage with his office, suggest possible areas and themes for inspection and bring their expertise about the performance of the Home Office to ensure that important issues are brought to his attention.

Members

The group is chaired by the Independent Chief Inspector of Borders and Immigration.

Its members are representatives from:

  • Amnesty International
  • Asylum Support Appeals Project
  • Asylum Aid
  • Immigration Law Practitioners Association (ILPA)
  • Liberty
  • Freedom from Torture
  • Refugee Action
  • Refugee Childrenâ€™s Consortium
  • Refugee Council
  • Scottish Refugee Council
  • UK Lesbian & Gay Immigration Group
  • UNHCR London
  • Independent Advisory Group on Country Information (IAGCI)

Membership of the refugee and asylum forum is at the invitation of the Independent Chief Inspector and is made up of individuals and organisations operating in the asylum and refugee fields.

Refugee and asylum forum minutes 16 July 2014 (PDF, 157KB, 12 pages)

See the National Archives website for previous minutes.

Seaports stakeholder forum

This forum has been created by the Independent Chief Inspector of Borders and Immigration to develop regular opportunities for expert seaport stakeholders to engage with his office, suggest possible areas and themes for inspection and bring their expertise about the performance of the Home Office to ensure that important issues are brought to his attention.

Members

The group is chaired by the Independent Chief Inspector of Borders and Immigration.

The seaports stakeholder forum consists of representatives from:

  • UK Chamber of Shipping
  • British Ports Association
  • ACPO
  • UK Major Ports Group

Seaports stakeholder forum minutes 4 June 2015 (PDF, 288KB, 3 pages)

See the National Archives website for previous minutes.

Aviation stakeholder forum

This forum has been created by the Independent Chief Inspector of the Borders and Immigration to develop opportunities for expert aviation stakeholders to engage with his office, suggest possible areas and themes for inspection and bring their expertise about the performance of the Home Office to ensure that important issues are brought to his attention.

  • British Airways
  • Easy Jet
  • TUI
  • Virgin Atlantic
  • Board of Airline Representatives UK
  • SITA UK
  • Airline Operators Association (AOA)
  • London City Airport
  • London Gatwick Airport
  • Heathrow Airport
  • Cardiff Airport
  • Manchester Airport Group including Manchester, Stansted, East Midlands, Bournemouth

Aviation stakeholder forum minutes 4 February 2016 (PDF, 300KB, 2 pages)

See the National Archives website for previous minutes.
